borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed first floor side extension by reason of its irregular roof design and form is considered unsympathetic to the original dwellinghouse. </span>This is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>

<div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed first floor rear extension and&nbsp;ground floor rear infill extension by reason of its excessive scale results in a bulky appearance against the original dwellinghouse. It is regarded as an overdevelopment to the property.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>This is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>

<div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed first floor rear extension by reason of its scale and siting&nbsp;would result in&nbsp;a harmful loss of privacy&nbsp;and daylight to neighbouring occupiers. In addition, the combined excessive massing by&nbsp;the proposed development will result in in an increased sense of overbearingness to neighbouring occupiers. T</span>herefore, the proposed development constitutes an unneighbourly development and is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies &nbsp;DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>
description: Construction of first floor side and rear extension with a pitched roof and a ground floor rear infill extension with a flat roof.
